intro: Leontice minor, commonly known as lesser leontice, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rosaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, trifoliate leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
